subject: Philosophy
title: Socrates on Virtue
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Socrates on Virtue.

hook.text: Socrates made a shocking claim: no one does wrong on purpose. Evil comes from ignorance, not malice.

buildup.text: If you truly understood what was good, you would do it. Doing wrong means you miscalculated.

discovery.text: Virtue is knowledge. If you know what courage, justice, and temperance truly are, you'll practice them.

twist.text: Critics protest: people often know the right thing and do the wrong thing anyway. Addiction, laziness, greed.

climax.text: Socrates would reply: you didn't really know. Deep understanding transforms behavior. Surface knowledge doesn't.

punchline.text: Know the good and you'll do the good. That's the Socratic bet.

quiz.question: What did Socrates believe about the relationship between knowledge and virtue?
options: True knowledge of the good leads to virtuous action
Only the gods can be virtuous
